page.title: 10NORTH BRENT - HOSPITAL
page.content: Northwick Park Hospital was opened in 1970. 5,000 people use it each week. Most beds are used for general medicine and obstetrics. About 1000 local people help the hospital in many ways such as running the shop. It has an important research centre. The hospital maintains a good relationship with the public, organising fetes and voluntary help. It is the principal accident hospital serving the whole of North London. The usage of beds is spread more or less evenly between cases for examination; obstetrics. general medicine and general surgery.About half the babies in the surrounding area are born in this hospital. The residents also use the geriatric hospital at Wembley, Central Middlesex Hospital at Park Royal, the Clementine Churchill Private Hospital and the main London Hospitals.
